Notes.Text:
This update for freeradius-server fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2019-11235: Fixed an authentication bypass related to the EAP-PWD Commit frame and insufficent validation of elliptic curve points (bsc#1132549).
- CVE-2019-11234: Fixed an authentication bypass caused by reflecting privous values back to the server (bsc#1132664).

Vulnerabilities.Description: FreeRADIUS before 3.0.19 does not prevent use of reflection for authentication spoofing, aka a "Dragonblood" issue, a similar issue to CVE-2019-9497.

Vulnerabilities.Description: FreeRADIUS before 3.0.19 mishandles the "each participant verifies that the received scalar is within a range, and that the received group element is a valid point on the curve being used" protection mechanism, aka a "Dragonblood" issue, a similar issue to CVE-2019-9498 and CVE-2019-9499.
